medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive increase in stature and difficulty in walking due to bilateral knock knees.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient showed a progressive increase in stature past 18 years of age, growing taller than peers and becoming the tallest in his family. He developed bilateral knock knees and difficulty walking. No fractures sustained throughout lifetime.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had not sustained any fracture in his lifetime.
medical_history.family_history: His mother died of breast cancer; father was 170 cm tall; no similar illness in the family.
